detail_view.task_title: Schedule Telehealth Visit for High BG Management

ai_insight.summary: Silvia Jones has reported significant post-dinner hyperglycemic events, with blood glucose levels spiking over 400 mg/dL. Recent events include a severe episode on 11/19/25 with a BG of 425 mg/dL at 7:25 PM despite correction doses of Humalog. Her A1C as of 10/15/25 was 9.2%, indicating suboptimal glycemic control. Meal patterns and insulin management need urgent review.
key_points: Severe post-dinner BG spikes noted, with recent events on 11/19 showing BG levels of 425 and 455 mg/dL.
Current A1C level at 9.2%, suggesting poor glycemic control.
Insulin regimen includes Humalog with meals; however, effectiveness is in question.
Patient expresses adherence to meal plan but struggles with high BG levels post-dinner.

other_relevant_info: Elevated lipids with LDL at 142 and triglycerides at 220

timeline.details: Patient reported BG of 455 mg/dL post-meal without specific meal details, corrected with 8 units Humalog at 6:40 PM
Second spike to 425 mg/dL after dinner (potato soup, tomato meatball pasta, garlic bread), attempted correction with 6 units Humalog at 7:28 PM

suggested_messages.message: Hi Silvia, I've noticed your post-dinner blood glucose levels have been quite high recently, especially on 11/19. It's great that you're following your meal plan, but let's discuss some strategies to better manage these spikes. Can we schedule a telehealth visit to review your meal plan and insulin doses?
suggested_messages.rationale: Addressing post-dinner hyperglycemia by reviewing meal plans and insulin management.

suggested_messages.message: Schedule telehealth visit to address Silvia's post-dinner hyperglycemia, review meal plans, and adjust insulin regimen as needed.
suggested_messages.rationale: Direct intervention needed for glycemic control improvement.

protocol_steps: Offer phone call to discuss recent hyperglycemic events and management strategies.
Schedule a telehealth visit at a mutually agreed upon time to review meal patterns and insulin dosing.
Create custom to-do: ‘Review Insulin Management and Meal Planning’ for the day of the visit.
Update Google Calendar with scheduled telehealth visit details.

clinical_assessment.trends: Worsening post-dinner glycemic control, rising A1C
recommendations: Urgent telehealth visit for insulin regimen and meal plan review
Consider referral to RD for diet modification

relevant_data_points.significance: Current insulin management may be inadequate.

caveats: This summary may be missing information. VI could not find: Recent detailed meal logs. Please refresh or review protocol.
Summary based on data last updated on 02/04/2026. If you believe this is out of date, please check the patient profile.

protocol.content:
Task: SCHEDULE TELEHEALTH VISIT
Code: ENG-101
Priority: P1
Program: lightpath
Trigger: Verily Me App NUX
Criteria: 14 days post enrollment \+ a new member assigned to the care team.
Steps (general): New Members:  Offer phone call (optional \- highly encouraged if member is not engaging in the in app content or T1D) Schedule a call at a mutually agreed upon time Create custom to do: ‘NUX Telehealth Visit’ and schedule for the day of the visit Update your Google Calendar  [NUX Telehealth]() Onduo Members: Decline (archive) this TO DO
